revised_title: Reversed Tracings in Sphygmography and Their Explanation
tldr: The author investigates reversed tracings in pulse recordings using the sphygmograph and discovers that they occur when the instrument's brass plate presses on the artery. The pressure from the brass plate can cause the amplitude of the tracing to be artificially increased or result in a reversed tracing. The author provides practical advice on using the sphygmograph to avoid these issues.
